{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3352631,"name":"","username":"Ishan1","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/439d5e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-04T22:28:24.941Z","cooked":"

Hello,

We are unable to get latency and timestamp from our Limelight 3G, using limelight helpers, it just returns 0. However the pose from the limelight is correct.

Our limelight firmware version and ll helpers are up to date.
Here is the current code that relates to pose estimation:
VisionSubsystem.java (6.3 KB)
DriveCommandBase.java (3.8 KB)

JSON output is probably disabled in your pipeline. JSON was disabled by default in a recent update.

I would recommend using the new MegaTag1 or MegaTag2 helper methods:

docs.limelightvision.io

Robot Localization with MegaTag | Limelight Documentation

If your Limelight's robot-space pose has been configured in the web ui, and a field map has been uploaded via the web ui, then the robot's location in field space

docs.limelightvision.io

Robot Localization with MegaTag2 | Limelight Documentation

Introduced in 2024, Megatag2 is a precise and ambiguity-free AprilTag-based localizer for mobile robots. It was built with the following goals:

Introducing MegaTag2 by Limelight Vision General Forum
MegaTag2: Setting a New Standard in Robot Localization Limelight MegaTag2 is an easy-to-use, trustworthy, and ambiguity-free robot localizer. Here are its key improvements over MegaTag1: Ambiguity-Free Localization With MegaTag2, we have eliminated the pose ambiguity problem and significantly increased robustness against image/corner noise. Superior Pose Estimation No matter the perspective, MegaTag2 provides excellent estimates given one or multiple tags. Robust Against Physical Inaccuracies …
